sentences.en: A common , but low exclamation of surprise and admiration escaped every mouth.
sentences.cn: 所有的人异口同声发出一声低低的惊叹.

sentences.en: Does it bother you if your name is used in a frustrated exclamation?
sentences.cn: 如果你的名字被用作灰心丧气时的感叹语助词,你会介意 吗 ?

sentences.en: For my part , I cannot keep from uttering an exclamation of surprise!
sentences.cn: 我那时是惊奇地叫了一声的!

sentences.en: He could not restrain an exclamation of approval.
He gave an exclamation of surprise.
Jennifer uttered an exclamation of pleasure as his racquet emerged from its coverings.
sentences.cn: 当球拍从包裹布下露出来时,詹尼弗发出了一声喜悦的惊叹.

sentences.en: Molly let out her breath, made an exclamation with her hands.
sentences.cn: 莫莉呼了口气, 用她的双手作了个吃惊的动作.

sentences.en: She uttered an inarticulate exclamation, and stood fixed.
sentences.cn: 她发出一声不清晰的叫声, 便站在那里不动了.

sentences.en: Sue gave an exclamation as we got a clear sight of the house.
sentences.cn: 我们清楚看到那所房子时，休惊叹不已。

sentences.en: The author used three exclamation marks at the end of the last sentence to wake up the readers.
sentences.cn: 作者在文章的最后一句连用了三个惊叹号,以引起读者的注意.
大家异口同声的叫喊起来.

sentences.en: There was a long silence on the other end of the wire, followed by an exclamation.
sentences.cn: 电话线那头沉默了好久, 接着是一声惊叫.

sentences.en: This exclamation was abrupt , but it was also perfectly calculated.
sentences.cn: 这一句有份量的话虽然显得突兀, 却是深思熟虑,工于心计的.

sentences.en: Wilson threw a body aside, and then stepped back with an exclamation.
sentences.cn: 威尔逊推开了一具尸体, 突然惊叫一声,往后直退.

sentences.en: With an exclamation of impatience, but with his Unchangeable face, Monseigneur looked out.
sentences.cn: 大人发出一声不耐烦的惊叹, 那张不动声色的脸往外望了望.

trans.tran_en: a sound, word, or short sentence that you say suddenly and loudly because you are surprised, angry, or excited
